intro: Dimorphostemon asper, commonly known as the rough dimorphostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have four petals. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and compact growth habit.
